intro: Allagoptera, commonly known as the goldenrod, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its showy, clustered yellow flowers that bloom in late summer and early autumn. The plants typically have narrow, linear leaves and can grow as annuals or perennials depending on the species. Allagoptera species are native to various regions in the Americas and are often found in open fields, roadsides, and disturbed soils. They play an important role in supporting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
